title: How to Make Shamrock Brownies

steps.headline: Grease and flour a 13 inch x 9 inch pan.
Combine the dry ingredients together in a large bowl.
steps.description: Mix the cocoa powder, flour, sugar, and salt together until well combined.

steps.headline: Blend the wet ingredients in a separate bowl.
steps.description: Combine the vanilla extract, eggs, and oil together with an electric mixer for about 2 minutes.

steps.headline: Pour the dry ingredients in with the wet ingredients.
steps.description: Blend slowly with an electric mixer until there are no flour streaks. Add the chocolate chips and mix once more until incorporated properly.

steps.headline: Pour the brownie batter out on the pan.
steps.description: Use a rubber spatula to spread it out evenly.

steps.headline: Bake the brownies for 25-30 minutes until the edges crisp.
Allow the brownies to cool for 10 minutes.
Cut the brownies out into shamrock pieces.
steps.description: Press down on the brownies with a  shamrock-shaped cookie cutter. Use a spatula to to remove the brownies and lay them on a plate.

steps.headline: Decorate as you wish.
steps.description: Ice and drizzle the green and white icing on top of the brownies. Top with powdered sugar.

text: Preheat the oven to 350 °F (177 °C).  Grease and flour a 13 inch x 9 inch pan. Set aside for later use. Combine the dry ingredients together in a large bowl. Mix the cocoa powder, flour, sugar, and salt together until well combined. Blend the wet ingredients in a separate bowl. Combine the vanilla extract, eggs, and oil together with an electric mixer for about 2 minutes. Pour the dry ingredients in with the wet ingredients. Blend slowly with an electric mixer until there are no flour streaks. Add the chocolate chips and mix once more until incorporated properly. Pour the brownie batter out on the pan. Use a rubber spatula to spread it out evenly. Bake the brownies for 25-30 minutes until the edges crisp.  Allow the brownies to cool for 10 minutes.  Cut the brownies out into shamrock pieces. Press down on the brownies with a  shamrock-shaped cookie cutter. Use a spatula to to remove the brownies and lay them on a plate. Decorate as you wish. Ice and drizzle the green and white icing on top of the brownies. Top with powdered sugar. Serve and enjoy!
